Highlights

  • Workday Again Named a Leader in 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Financial Planning Software (Dec 4, 2025)

    Workday has once again been positioned as a leader in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Financial Planning Software, sustaining this position for the fourth year. The analyst report points to Workday‚Äôs breadth in financial planning, deep integration with HR and analytics, and strong innovation cycle around AI-powered capabilities.

    Strategically, this places Workday ahead in the minds of enterprise buyers demanding comprehensive, AI-driven planning solutions. The persistent analyst endorsement provides validation for existing clients and new prospects evaluating the platform, reducing perceived risk and enhancing deal confidence. For Deloitte‚Äôs Workday practice, this recognition is an immediately reusable asset in competitive RFP response, positioning Deloitte as the trusted partner to help clients extract maximum value from Workday‚Äôs maturing finance and HCM stack.

    Read more on Workday Newsroom
  • Workday President to Present at Barclays 23rd Annual Global Technology Conference (Announced Dec 4, 2025)

    Workday confirmed that President Robynne Sisco will present at the upcoming Barclays Global Technology Conference. Such leadership visibility underscores Workday‚Äôs intent to define key market themes‚Äîespecially regarding finance, HCM, and AI priorities. While not a new solution announcement per se, these sessions tend to set the tone for 2026 enterprise evaluations and client conversations.

    For Deloitte, tracking and amplifying Workday‚Äôs leadership commentary at Barclays enables faster dissemination of future-oriented messaging into both internal training and client briefings. Sisco's participation signals that Workday is prioritizing continued innovation and transparency‚Äîimportant angles for differentiating the platform in strategic deals.

    Read the announcement

Competitive Watch

  • SAP:

    SAP continues to enhance AI features within its SuccessFactors suite, particularly around agentic and skills-based capabilities. However, in the last 24 hours, no net-new updates shifted their position. Workday‚Äôs current analyst recognition remains unmatched in financial planning, providing a clear messaging advantage in enterprise platform selection cycles. This gap should be leveraged in deal strategies and client workshops.

  • Oracle:

    No significant new moves from Oracle were announced in the last 24-hour window. Oracle keeps investing in AI for HCM and ERP, but Workday‚Äôs fresh third-party validation strengthens its posture, especially for finance-focused buying groups. Deloitte can use this window to reinforce Workday‚Äôs edge when competitive activity is quieter.

  • UKG:

    UKG‚Äôs emphasis remains on its Bryte AI agents and ongoing client enablement, but without significant product expansion in this period. Market impact from this continues, but the latest independent recognition for Workday sets a higher bar for credibility and trust with finance and HR leaders.

Enablement

  • Articulating Workday‚Äôs Leadership in Financial Planning and AI - Gartner MQ Source
    In the next 90 days, enable client teams to confidently position Workday‚Äôs finance and analytics stack as both innovative and low-risk, supported by visible analyst validation. This reinforces Deloitte‚Äôs advisory credibility in client pursuits.
  • Staying Informed on Workday Executive Messaging - Barclays Conference Announcement
    Use ongoing Workday executive insights to update strategy decks, pursuit materials, and internal enablement‚Äîempowering teams to act on the very latest messages and product priorities.

Actions for Next Week

  • Attend or review highlights from the Barclays Conference keynote for the clearest forecast of Workday‚Äôs upcoming AI and platform vision.
  • Refresh all external and internal facing material to spotlight Workday‚Äôs new Magic Quadrant recognition, especially for prospects in financial services, healthcare, and multi-entity environments.
  • Track any rapid response from SAP, Oracle, or UKG to shift the competitive narrative.
  • Study and share forward-looking commentary from Workday‚Äôs leadership for immediate client application.

Risks & Mitigations

  • Risk: Loss of narrative control due to competitor messaging.
    Mitigation: Ensure teams are equipped with latest analyst accolades and clear, recent leadership proof points to maintain market messaging leadership.
  • Risk: Over-reliance on legacy recognition metrics.
    Mitigation: Supplement reference to past recognition with current insights from executive conferences and product roadmap updates.

Return JSON ONLY in this exact shape (no code fences, no extra text):

{
  "type": "daily or weekly",
  "run_date": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "title": "Short headline",
  "priority_focus": "1‚Äì2 sentences on what matters most now",
  "highlights": [
    { "headline": "‚Ä¶", "why_it_matters": "‚Ä¶", "source_url": "https://‚Ä¶" }
  ],
  "competitive_watch": [
    { "competitor": "Name", "move": "‚Ä¶", "implication": "‚Ä¶" }
  ],
  "enablement": [
    { "skill": "Topic", "resource_url": "https://‚Ä¶", "90_day_outcome": "‚Ä¶" }
  ],
  "actions_next_week": ["‚Ä¶"],
  "risks": [
    { "risk": "‚Ä¶", "mitigation": "‚Ä¶" }
  ],
  "sources": [
    { "title": "‚Ä¶", "url": "https://‚Ä¶" }
  ],
  "html_body": "<h2>‚Ä¶</h2> (well-formatted HTML with <a href="https://‚Ä¶">links</a>; no scripts/external CSS)",
  "plain_text_body": "Text-only with visible URLs"
}

Parameters:
- Set "run_date" to TODAY_ET = 2025-12-05.
- For DAILY: set "type":"daily"; target ~1000 words; STRICTLY restrict to the last 24 hours (from 2025-12-04T06:38 to 2025-12-05T06:38); include publication dates in highlight text.
- For WEEKLY: set "type":"weekly"; target 2000‚Äì2500 words; restrict to 2025-11-28‚Ä¶2025-12-05; include <h3>What changed this week</h3> and publication dates in highlight text.
- Section order for html_body: Highlights; Competitive Watch; Enablement; Actions for Next Week; Risks & Mitigations; All Sources.
- Every item must include at least one absolute URL (https://‚Ä¶).
- Keep total HTML under ~25KB.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
- For every highlight and competitive_watch item, include a 2‚Äì3 paragraph detailed summary within the "why_it_matters" text.
- Where relevant, compare perspectives across multiple sources.
- Include a clear "so what" statement for Deloitte‚Äôs Workday practice.
- Ensure all cited URLs appear in the `sources` array and inside the `html_body` link text.
- Keep factual accuracy and avoid speculation.

Most AI agents in the market today are task-based and follow specific step-by-step instructions. Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach believes task-based agents must evolve into role-based agents, which contain a configurable set of skills that give them more autonomy and the ability to better support humans in particular roles.",

      "url": "https://forum.wordreference.com/threads/jour-ouvr√©-jour-ouvrable.607089/",
      "content": "workday is AE, then (I didn't know that)  \n   \n I believe we would only say a working day for a day when you you choose or are assigned to work (if you don't have a standard Mon-Fri work assignment).  \n   \n Next week Saturday is a working day (or workday) for me, so I can't play golf then. Si j'ai bien compris l'exemple donn√© par staarkali, √ßa pourrait √™tre l'√©quivalent de jour ouvr√©. [...] My understanding of the GDT definitions is that you cannot say jour ouvr√©, unless you actually work that day.   \n   \n Monday to Friday is the regular workweek/working week or schedule of workdays/working days.   \n   \n Some places open on Saturday, and other places (e.g. convenience stores) are open 7 days a week. You can be scheduled to work, or not. Those days are all ouvrables but not necessarity ouvr√©s (worked) by every employee on the payroll. [...] I also say workday, for jour ouvrable, though I don't mind working day. But jour ouvrable suivant = next business day. I thik business day is mostly used for commerce and finance.   \n   \n Now - as already suggested - there is a difference to be made between jour ouvr√© and jour ouvrable.   \n   \n As found in the GDT, under jour ouvrable  \n> D√©finition :  \n>  Jour de la semaine qui est normalement consacr√© au travail ou aux activit√©s professionnelles et qui n'est pas un jour f√©ri√©.",

    {
      "title": "\"workday\" or \"work day\" | WordReference Forums",
      "url": "https://forum.wordreference.com/threads/workday-or-work-day.2945218/",
      "content": "Workday (noun) = (i) days upon which most people work, e.g. \"Next Monday is a public holiday, but Tuesday will be a normal workday. (ii) days upon which specific people work, e.g. \"Saturday and Sunday are normal workdays for policemen.\"\n\n (i) adjective relating to days upon which most people work, e.g. \"Today, she would not go anywhere special, so she put on her workday clothes.\"\n\n  more commonly \"working day\".\n\n   Image 9: Agree\n\nReactions:futursimple\n\nImage 10: KHS\n\n#### KHS [...] \"Work a day\" (adjective) = mundane; common; usual; standard (of quality); \"The new cell phone is not remarkable at all, it has a workaday processor and last year's screen.\" (Often used in the phrase \"[in the] workaday world of high finance/professional football/aviation/teaching, etc, etc.\" meaning 'normal and not exciting area of activity') [...] ##### Senior Member\n\nCharlotte, North Carolina, USA\n\n USA - English L1 \n\n   Dec 30, 2014\n\n   \n\n   Contact us\n   Terms and rules\n   Privacy policy\n   Help\n   RSS\n\nCommunity platform by XenForo¬Æ¬© 2010-2025 XenForo Ltd.\n\nBack\n\nTopBottom",

By taking proactive measures, making thoughtful investments in this area, and engaging with valued stakeholders, we‚Äôll help shape a future where RAI becomes a driving force for positive change at Workday and beyond. [...] > One of the most important guidelines is to always incorporate human review of any outputs generated from the AI technology that we release.\n\n## The Future of Responsible AI\n\nLooking ahead, Workday is committed to further enhancing our RAI governance program. We continue to expand our RAI team and designate additional Workmates as RAI Champions, fostering a culture of awareness and accountability. [...] One of the most important guidelines is to always incorporate human review of any outputs generated from the AI technology that we release. Our guidelines also highlight the importance of transparency and disclosure, which we operationalize primarily through our machine learning fact sheets, providing our customers with a clear understanding of how our AI and ML technologies are developed and assessed in order to help mitigate any risks associated with their use.       "title": "Data Governance Automation: Benefits and Use Cases | Workday US",
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/en-us/data-governance-automation-benefits-use-cases.html",
      "content": "When automation and AI operate in tandem, governance shifts from reactive control to continuous assurance. [...] By integrating AI-driven insights into your governance engine, you create a system that not only enforces rules but anticipates issues, continuously refines controls, and empowers your team to focus on strategy rather than data maintenance.\n\n> Gartner predicts that without a catalyst for modernization, 80% of data governance strategies will fail by 2027.\n\n## Solutions for a Strong Governance Foundation [...] While automation rapidly executes across governance pillars, it still runs on fixed rules.       "content": "## Responsible AI at Workday.\n\nWorkday is  an industry leader in responsible AI (RAI) governance‚Äîand we want our AI to be a force for good. That‚Äôs why we thoroughly assess and manage AI risks. Our team collaborates across Workday to make sure our AI is built to respect human rights and safety, and truly benefits society by implementing responsible AI by design. [...] The tier is determined by factors including the product‚Äôs ability to make predictions or categorizations relating to individual workers, its potential for primary or secondary impact to their economic opportunities, and additional aspects relating to the characteristics or context of AI being utilized. We also account for ‚ÄúProhibited Risk‚Äù in this evaluation to identify use cases that fall outside of our approved governance structure due to potential harm caused to people or threats to [...] At Workday, we prioritize transparency‚Äîproviding clear information to support decision-making.     {
      "title": "\"workday\" or \"work day\" | WordReference Forums",
      "url": "https://forum.wordreference.com/threads/workday-or-work-day.2945218/",
      "content": "Workday (noun) = (i) days upon which most people work, e.g. \"Next Monday is a public holiday, but Tuesday will be a normal workday. (ii) days upon which specific people work, e.g. \"Saturday and Sunday are normal workdays for policemen.\"\n\n (i) adjective relating to days upon which most people work, e.g. \"Today, she would not go anywhere special, so she put on her workday clothes.\"\n\n  more commonly \"working day\".\n\n   Image 9: Agree\n\nReactions:futursimple\n\nImage 10: KHS\n\n#### KHS [...] ##### Senior Member\n\nCharlotte, North Carolina, USA\n\n USA - English L1 \n\n   Dec 30, 2014\n\n   \n\n   Contact us\n   Terms and rules\n   Privacy policy\n   Help\n   RSS\n\nCommunity platform by XenForo¬Æ¬© 2010-2025 XenForo Ltd.\n\nBack\n\nTopBottom [...] \"workday\" or \"work day\" | WordReference Forums\n\nImage 1: WordReference Forums\n\nWordReference.comLanguage Forums\n\nImage 2: WordReference Forums\n\n   Forums there are 3 words:",

      "content": "Like Carolinian, I would say work day, or the closed forum workday.  \n Our dictionaries recognize this as a difference between British and American English.  \n   \n From Collins Concise English Dictionary, a British English dictionary.  \n\nworking day, esp us workday‚Äã\n\n1. a day on which work is done, esp for an agreed or stipulated number of hours in return for a salary or wage\n\nYou must log in or register to reply here.\n\nShare:\n\nBluesky   LinkedIn   WhatsApp   Email   Share   Link [...] You are using an out of date browser.       "url": "https://forum.wordreference.com/threads/jour-ouvr√©-jour-ouvrable.607089/",
      "content": "workday is AE, then (I didn't know that)  \n   \n I believe we would only say a working day for a day when you you choose or are assigned to work (if you don't have a standard Mon-Fri work assignment).  \n   \n Next week Saturday is a working day (or workday) for me, so I can't play golf then. Si j'ai bien compris l'exemple donn√© par staarkali, √ßa pourrait √™tre l'√©quivalent de jour ouvr√©. [...] jour ouvrable / jour de travail = workday/working day  \n jour ouvr√© / jour travaill√© = day worked\n\n#### Staarkali\n\n##### Senior Member\n\n‰∏äÊµ∑ÔºåShanghai\n\nFrance\n\n #7\n\nthanks for all these answers; to sum up, it appears that:  \n for jour ouvrable, workday apparently best fits the bill, but working day and business day may works as well  \n for jour ouvr√©, day worked might be the only choice\n\n#### broglet\n\n##### Senior Member\n\nLondon\n\nEnglish - England\n\n #8 [...] I also say workday, for jour ouvrable, though I don't mind working day. I thik business day is mostly used for commerce and finance.   \n   \n Now - as already suggested - there is a difference to be made between jour ouvr√© and jour ouvrable.   \n   \n As found in the GDT, under jour ouvrable  \n> D√©finition :  \n>  Jour de la semaine qui est normalement consacr√© au travail ou aux activit√©s professionnelles et qui n'est pas un jour f√©ri√©.",

[...] That is correct - you do not get paid. When you do work experiance, you get one or two weeks of school and you go and work in a local library, a shop, whatever will accept you. Or none of these?\n\nC [...] Hmmm... In US English, for the purposes of scheduling, a business day is Monday through Friday. If you ask for something on Friday and you won't get it until Tuesday, they say it will be two business days even if they are open on Saturday or Sunday.  \n \"Working day\" has other meanings (like \"How long is your working day? Eight hours\" which is part of the reason why it has more uses.)\n\n#### morzh\n\n##### Banned\n\nUSA\n\nRussian\n\n #12\n\nBusiness is what fits here.\n\n#### cycloneviv [...] You must log in or register to reply here.\n\nShare:\n\nBluesky   LinkedIn   WhatsApp   Email   Share   Link\n\n English Only\n English Only\n\nTop Bottom",

      "title": "Automate tasks in your application using AI agents - Amazon ...",
      "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/latest/userguide/agents.html",
      "content": "Amazon Bedrock Agents offers you the ability to build and configure autonomous agents in your application. An agent helps your end-users complete actions based on organization data and user input. Agents orchestrate interactions between foundation models (FMs), data sources, software applications, and user conversations. In addition, agents automatically call APIs to take actions and invoke knowledge bases to supplement information for these actions. By integrating agents, you can accelerate [...] With agents, you can automate tasks for your customers and answer questions for them. For example, you can create an agent that helps customers process insurance claims or an agent that helps customers make travel reservations. You don't have to provision capacity, manage infrastructure, or write custom code. Amazon Bedrock manages prompt engineering, memory, monitoring, encryption, user permissions, and API invocation.\n\nAgents perform the following tasks: [...] Automate tasks in your application using AI agents - Amazon Bedrock\n\nDocumentationAmazon BedrockUser Guide\n\n# Automate tasks in your application using AI agents",

The agent also invokes the FM to generate responses and follow-up steps in its process.\n Instructions ‚Äì You write instructions that describe what the agent is designed to do. With advanced prompts, you can further customize instructions for the agent at every step of orchestration and include Lambda functions to parse each step's output.       "content": "AI bias can stem from flawed data, algorithmic design and human judgment, leading to outcomes that may perpetuate societal inequalities.\n Mitigating AI bias requires a human-centric approach: conducting data audits, re-evaluating algorithms and grounding decisions in societal contexts.\n Long-term solutions include continuous monitoring, interdisciplinary collaboration, and aligning AI outcomes with ethical principles and societal wellbeing. [...] #### Understanding and mitigating bias in AI systems is critical to fostering fairness, promoting responsible AI practices and driving equitable societal outcomes.\n\n##### In brief [...] Bias in AI systems poses serious challenges that can lead to unfair treatment and systemic discrimination. To combat these issues, organizations must implement strategies like data audits and algorithm testing, while fostering collaboration and public awareness. Recognizing the implications for individuals and society, identifying types of bias, and developing strategies for monitoring and mitigating bias are essential for creating fairer and more responsible AI systems.\n\nAbout this article",

      "title": "\"workday\" or \"work day\" | WordReference Forums",
      "url": "https://forum.wordreference.com/threads/workday-or-work-day.2945218/",
      "content": "Workday (noun) = (i) days upon which most people work, e.g. \"Next Monday is a public holiday, but Tuesday will be a normal workday. (ii) days upon which specific people work, e.g. \"Saturday and Sunday are normal workdays for policemen.\"\n\n (i) adjective relating to days upon which most people work, e.g. \"Today, she would not go anywhere special, so she put on her workday clothes.\"\n\n  more commonly \"working day\".\n\n   Image 9: Agree\n\nReactions:futursimple\n\nImage 10: KHS\n\n#### KHS [...] \"Work a day\" (adjective) = mundane; common; usual; standard (of quality); \"The new cell phone is not remarkable at all, it has a workaday processor and last year's screen.\" (Often used in the phrase \"[in the] workaday world of high finance/professional football/aviation/teaching, etc, etc.\" meaning 'normal and not exciting area of activity') [...] ##### Senior Member\n\nCharlotte, North Carolina, USA\n\n USA - English L1 \n\n   Dec 30, 2014\n\n   \n\n   Contact us\n   Terms and rules\n   Privacy policy\n   Help\n   RSS\n\nCommunity platform by XenForo¬Æ¬© 2010-2025 XenForo Ltd.\n\nBack\n\nTopBottom",

      "content": "workday is AE, then (I didn't know that)  \n   \n I believe we would only say a working day for a day when you you choose or are assigned to work (if you don't have a standard Mon-Fri work assignment).  \n   \n Next week Saturday is a working day (or workday) for me, so I can't play golf then. Si j'ai bien compris l'exemple donn√© par staarkali, √ßa pourrait √™tre l'√©quivalent de jour ouvr√©. [...] jour ouvrable / jour de travail = workday/working day  \n jour ouvr√© / jour travaill√© = day worked\n\n#### Staarkali\n\n##### Senior Member\n\n‰∏äÊµ∑ÔºåShanghai\n\nFrance\n\n #7\n\nthanks for all these answers; to sum up, it appears that:  \n for jour ouvrable, workday apparently best fits the bill, but working day and business day may works as well  \n for jour ouvr√©, day worked might be the only choice\n\n#### broglet\n\n##### Senior Member\n\nLondon\n\nEnglish - England\n\n #8 [...] My understanding of the GDT definitions is that you cannot say jour ouvr√©, unless you actually work that day.   \n   \n Monday to Friday is the regular workweek/working week or schedule of workdays/working days.   \n   \n Some places open on Saturday, and other places (e.g. convenience stores) are open 7 days a week. You can be scheduled to work, or not. Those days are all ouvrables but not necessarity ouvr√©s (worked) by every employee on the payroll.",

It plays a role similar to a control plane in cloud or network architectures, sitting above the underlying systems to provide unified oversight and intervention.       "content": "‚ÄúWe decided to call them AI coworkers, and we set up an AI staffing team co-owned between my technology team and our chief people officer and her HR team,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThat team is responsible for hiring AI coworkers and bringing them into the organization.‚Äù You heard that right: ‚Äúhiring.‚Äù\n\nThe first step is to sit down with the business leader and write a job description, which is fed to the AI agent, and then it becomes known as an intern. [...] Another aspect of the agentic economy is instead of a human employee talking to a vendor‚Äôs AI agent, a company agent can handle the conversation on the employee‚Äôs behalf. And if a company wants to switch vendors, the experience will be seamless for employees, since they never had to deal directly with the vendor anyway. [...] According to a National Research Group survey of more than 3,000 senior leaders, more than half of executives say their organization is already using AI agents. Of the companies that spend no less than half their AI budget on AI agents, 88% say they‚Äôre already seeing ROI on at least one use case, with top areas being customer service and experience, marketing, cybersecurity, and software development.",

Certified in repairing German cars, he spends his weekends fixing and driving them for the tangible satisfaction of solving a completely different kind of problem before returning to the complex challenges of healthcare on Monday morning.\n\nReport\n\n### C-Suite Global AI Indicator Report: AI Is the Ultimate Level-Up\n\nRead Now\n\nShare this Perspective\n\n4. They try to understand, ‚ÄúOf the vast universe of potential candidates, how do we clean the data and understand who the right candidate might be?‚Äù Then a separate agent goes through and scores those candidates and does the ranking and the sourcing process. A separate agent reaches out to gain contact and schedule interviews. [...] And then I think HR will play a key role‚Äîfirst, to really push the business on what can be done from a hybrid workforce perspective. Second, and we started seeing this in one of my clients, is where the technology is up and running, but the number of live interactions is not coming down. There is a big change management component that comes into play. HR will be absolutely critical there. [...] Think of a call center or store environment. You generate an agentic customer, and you say, ‚ÄúThis is a type of call. This is a type of customer. Record an interaction.‚Äù It‚Äôs not only simulating a real phone call.
